attributes.action: ensure person or persons charged with crimes of 'GBH with intent to kill' or 'Attempted Murder' cannot be bailed back into the same community as the victim whilst awaiting trial.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Case-in-point, relates to a 15 year old boy who was stabbed multiple times by an adult male living not half a mile away, who upon being charged with the crime by Police was then bailed back into the same community by the CPS pending a trial date set several months in the future.    

This has raised awareness to the fact that many victims of violent crime are likely to live and/or work in the same area as their attacker/s. In these instances the victim and family members are often subjected to further anguish and pain for sustained periods of time by having to endure almost daily contact with their attacker/s. 

If you believe this to be discriminatory to the human rights of a victim and their family members and wish the current law pertaining to the release of perpetrator/s charged with violent crimes to be reviewed, sign this petition.
